DOC.brief_summary: The purpose research evaluate efficacy Strong Families Strong Forces Parenting Program compare parental self-care ( Strong Parents ) condition sample 150 Active Duty Families child age birth 5 year .
DOC.brief_title: Strong Families Strong Forces : Supporting Active Duty Families With Very Young Children
DOC.detailed_description: The overall aim research adapt evaluate efficacy parent program compare parental self-care program Active Duty family . A sample 150 Active Duty family young child parent schedule deploy next six month recruit participate . Families assign either receive Strong Families Strong Forces Parenting Program , design reduce impact deployment separation parent stress co-parenting , Strong Parents Self-Care program , design support parent focus importance self-care throughout deployment cycle . Investigators compare two group parent stress , quality parent-child relationship , parenting/co-parenting , family child well-being .
DOC.criteria: Cohabitating couple least one child age birth 5 year old one parent active duty schedule deploy within next 6 month Anticipated deployment time must least six month excludes separation due Service Member attend school Anticipate nondeploying parent remain area deployment Both parent willing consent study participation DEERS eligible 18 year old Englishspeaking The parent remain home care child anticipate remain within 30 mile Fort Hood see home , otherwise need see office Anticipate parent remain area least three month redeployment complete intervention followup assessment Any family member significant medical psychiatric condition require high level care provide study/comparison protocol Active psychosis mania
